listitem.para: Activate testGetMyPath() and observe the following error
listitem.programlisting: org.junit.ComparisonFailure: unexpected path expected:</accounts/[inject]> but was:</accounts/[something-like-this]>

listitem.para: The client used a path calculated form the JAXR-RS resource class and method.
The getMyPath() resource method used a hard-coded (bad) guess at what its path would be. Correct the resource method to use an injected UriInfo object so that it can return its actual path
Re-run testMyPath() and it should now pass if you are returning the correct path provided by UriInfo.
Activate testCreateAccountForm() and observe the following error
listitem.programlisting: java.lang.AssertionError: unexpected status from getMyPath:/jaxrscs-ex-war6/rest/accounts expected:<200> but was:<500> ... WARN [org.jboss.resteasy.core.SynchronousDispatcher] (Log4jLogger.java:error:135) -Failed executing POST /accounts org.jboss.resteasy.spi.InternalServerErrorException: Unknown @PathParam: ownerName for path: /accounts

listitem.para: Check the injected parameters into createAccount() and make sure they are correct for form encoded parameters.
Once you have the parameters corrected, re-run and testCreateAccountForm() should report the following error
listitem.programlisting: java.lang.AssertionError: unexpected status from getMyPath:/jaxrscs-ex-war6/rest/accounts expected:<201> but was:<200>

listitem.para: With the default/simple implementation, we can return the Account XML document and a 200 OK status code. Update createAccount() to return a 201 Created status code and the XML Account. You will need to use a Response object.

With the Response object returning a 201 Created status and the Account XML document, testCreateAccount() should now be passing. You can try to access the method from an HTML form using at the root URL. You will have to set a breakpoint in your unit test to access the Jetty servlet from a browser. You will need to deploy the application to JBoss before being able to access the JBoss URL.
